subject: RE: [junit] coverage testing
msgSnippet: What I d definitely want (and Hansel doesn t have to my knowledge) is the possibility to annotate methods in the code under test that don t need full test
messageBody:
What I'd definitely want (and Hansel doesn't have to my knowledge) is the
possibility to annotate methods in the code under test that don't need full
test coverage (such as toString only used for debugging purposes).

Cheers, Ilja
